SENT.plain: A female infant presented with Adams-Oliver syndrome (AOS), intrauterine growth retardation, severe cutis marmorata telangiectatica congenita, bilateral congenital cataract, and periventricular lesions
The here-reported association of bilateral congenital cataract with AOS is original
Adams-Oliver syndrome is a genetic defect that causes a vasculopathy and leads to a variety of phenotypes
This observation further supports the current understanding of the physiopathology of AOS
